Examples

Example 1: Useing user login form

This example shows an login form that can be placed everywhere on your page.


<div id="userexample1" swa="User TEMPLATE user_form"></div>
        

var user_options = {
    loginURL: '../data/user/exampleuserdata.json'   // URL where to verify user
};
Open example

Example 2: Overlay page with modal dialog for login

This example hides the page contents behind a overlay that prompts the user to login. After login the page is shown.


<div id="userexample2" swa="User TEMPLATE user_modal"></div>
        

var user_options = {
    loginURL: '../data/user/exampleuserdata.json'
};
Open example

Example 3: Login button with configured redirects

Third kind of login dialog is a simple button that opens a menue on mouse over, where user can login.
Also this example demonstrates how you can set locations to that the user is redirected after login or logout.


<div id="user" swa="User"></div>
        

var user_options = {
    loginURL: '../data/user/exampleuserdata.json',
    afterLoginLoc: '../sites/user_example1.html',
    afterLogoutLoc: '../sites/user.html'
};
Open example

Example 4: User registration page

For a user registration page you can use the Edit component. Simply create a form with the input fields you want and give them the names of the supported user attributes.
List of supported user attributes:

  • Username
  • Password
  • Firstname
  • Lastname
  • Street
  • Houseno
  • Zipcode
  • City
  • Country
  • Email
  • Phone
  • Language

<div id="create_user" swa="Edit FROM ../../SmartUser/smartuser/user">
    <form class="swac_editForm">
        <label class="uk-label" for="username">Username</label>
        <br><input id="username" class="uk-input uk-form-width-medium" name="username" required>
            <br>
                <label class="uk-label" for="password">Password</label>
                <br><input id="password" class="uk-input uk-form-width-medium" name="password" type="password" required>
                ...
            <div class="uk-margin">
            <button class="uk-button uk-button-default swac_editSaveButton">Edit.save</button>
        </div>
    </form>
</div>
        

var create_user_options = {
    showWhenNoData: true,
    allowAdd: true,
    directOpenNew: true,
    aterSave: function(fromName, set) {
        UIkit.modal.alert(window.swac.lang.dict.RoNeKo.savedredirect);
        window.location = 'regconfirm.html';
    }
};
Open example

Example 5: User registration confirmation page

You can define define in the options of SmartUser, that email adresses must be confirmed. Than a conformation email is send to the user containing an activation code.
To create a page that allows the confirmation put a simple form and the user component toghether. The login form will be hidden until the user has confirmed his adress.

Open example

Example 6: Onetime login per mail

The User component in combination with SmartUser offers the possibility to login per mail. When the user enters his email or username he recives a mail containing a link for a one time login. Clicking this link the user is logged in.
This can also be used for setting a new password.

Open example

Example 7: Check if user is logged in

You can request the user component to get information about the currently logged in user.


// Get user User component from page
let userElem = document.querySelector('[swa^="User"]');
// Check if component was found and user data is there
if(userElem?.swac_comp.userData) {
    ...
    userElem.swac_comp.userData.isadmin // usersdata should provide this boolean flag
}
